title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.35 | 21-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurunmeelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Prishtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shri Vasadi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tatho Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 35th verse of the 15th chapter.
Of the first canto of Shri Madbhagavatam.
Yatha Matsyadi Roopani Dhatte Jahyad Yatha Nataha
Bhubharat Shapito Yena Jaho Tacha Kalevaram
The meaning of this verse is
The Supreme Lord relinquished the body which he manifested
to diminish the burden of the earth.
Just like a magician he relinquishes one body
to accept different ones.
Like the fish incarnation and others.
This is another difficult verse to understand.
The way the Lord appears and disappears
in this material world in different forms
is very nicely explained by Shri Lasuta Goswami
in this particular verse.
Shri La Prabhupada elaborates in the purport
The Supreme Lord, personality of Godhead,
is neither impersonal nor formless.
Shri La Prabhupada elaborates in the purport
Two theories
Maya vada and Shunya vada
And the prayer we offer to Shri La Prabhupada
Nirvishesha Shunya Vadi Pashchakya Deshat Aryane
Nirvishesha Shunya Vadi Pashchakya Deshat Aryane
Prabhupada has come
Being empowered by the supreme Lord.
Being empowered by the supreme Lord.
God for the sake of delivering the specially the western countries which are filled with
this impersonalism and voidism.
So impersonal philosophy is that God is impersonal, God has no transcendental personality no personality
and the widest philosophy is God is void, shunya, formless, no form at all.
So the Vaishnavas based on the authentic scriptures explain and understand and realize the fact
that
the Supreme Lord Personality of Godhead is not impersonal, he is not formless, but his
body is non different from him.
Our body is different from our self, Krishna's form or body is not different from his self.
Therefore he is known as an embodiment, as the embodiment of eternity, knowledge and
bliss.
This is the description of the Brahma Samhita.
In the Brahad-Vaishnava Tantra, it is clearly mentioned that anyone who considers the form
of Lord Krishna to be made of material energy must be ostracized by all means.
What's the meaning of this?
That Krishna's form.
Krishna's form or body is never material, though it may appear like that, it may appear
like that, but it is not material, it is completely spiritual.
That means in that spiritual form there is no deterioration, there is no action of the
gunas, there is no death, there is no birth, there is no death.
There is no death.
There is no birth.
There is no death.
There is no death.
No birth.
There is no disease.
There is no pain.
There is no blood.
There is no flesh.
There is no bones.
There is no matter.
So, how to understand this?
Because when Krishna performs his pastimes, he appears to take birth as a small infant,
son of Devaki.
then later son of mother Yashoda and then he appears to grow he appears to grow from a small
infant like ordinarily any child will grow up but if there are changes in the body and the spiritual
body is eternal without any change then how do we understand that in spite of such
changes apparent changes the lord's body is completely spiritual changeless without
deterioration how do we understand this so that is explained that for the sake of his pastimes
he displays different kinds of forms suitable for the pastime suitable for the past
so the pastime requires Krishna to display his form as a small child of mother Yashoda he displays
that form if it requires that he display the form of four-handed Vishnu in front of Devaki and Vasudeva
to convince them that he is a supreme lord who has appeared as the son he displays that form
that's all he is what he is irrespective of what form he displays this is the point
so therefore the Brihadra Vaishnava Tantra says one should never consider the supreme lord's form
to be made of material energy or material matter it is not a material form our form this form
is made of matter therefore it has got blood and bones and and it is subject to deterioration it
gets diseased sometimes
subject to death this is material form whereas Krishna's form is not material form that's the
thing asserted here by Srila Prabhupada quoting the Brihadra Vaishnava Tantra further the Brihadra
Vaishnava Tantra says if by chance the face of such an infidel is seen one must clean himself
by jumping in the river with his clothing
that means never hear or never consider that the Lord's body is material like our
body no never if you happen to hear from somebody who is a infidel means he is a non-believer he is
a demon he is a faithless
materialist then better you cleanse yourself you cleanse yourself by taking
bath in a sacred river because all such contaminations are obstacles on the path
of progress in spiritual life therefore it is recommended like this
śrīlāprabhu for further saraśaṉadnikaśyap Yesterday the Lord's body was born
so Śrīla Prabhupada further says the Lord is described as amrita, or deathless because He has no
amrita, deathless so He doesn't have a material body only the material body is subject to birth and
death
so what is it that is described as born it is the body body is come to natürlich
body is born body is changing body is aging body is becoming infected with
disease not the soul not the spirit not the real you so please understand this
point so further Srila Prabhupada says under the circumstances the
Lord's dying or quitting his body is like the jugglery of a magician this is
proper explanation the magician shows by his tricks that he is cut into pieces
burnt to ashes or made unconscious by hypnotic influences but all are false
shows only I don't know if you have seen a been to a magic show especially the
magic show in which the magician himself he will make a demonstration
you
can see that he's put inside one box and then he will call somebody from the
audience and say I am in seven I am inside the box completely closed from
all sides then you take one knife and slit the box into two and then separate
the two halves of the box okay and then when this is done after this is done
the magician will come out of one of the parts of the box as if he has not been
cut at all so these are all tricks that
magician is performing to make it appear like he was in the box and somebody from
the audience came and cut the box into two pieces while he was inside and then
after that he comes out of the box intact without any cuts without any cut the magician will remove the仏
No

So, it is all appearances, they are false shows. Similarly, just as the magician himself is neither burnt to ashes nor cut to pieces, nor is he dead or unconscious at any stage of his magical demonstration.
Similarly, the Lord has his eternal forms of unlimited variety, of which the fish incarnation was exhibited within this universe, which was exhibited in this universe is also one of them.
So, Lord is not fish, neither is entering a fish body, he is coming in his original spiritual form as a fish, that is just exhibited.
Because there are.
There are innumerable universes, somewhere or other the fish incarnation must be manifesting his pastimes without cessation.
So, just like Krishna appeared 5000 years back in this material world.
So, when he appeared, the next moment Krishna is appearing in another universe as a small child.
Meantime, in this universe what is happening, he appears to be grown up, he has been transferred to Mother Yashoda's house from Devaki's lap in the prison.
So, in the other universe, after little time where he has appeared, he will again appear in another universe and in that other universe he will be transferred.
So, his pastimes are continuously going on, it appears like here some changes are happening, but actually his Leela is going on, he is not changing.
In this verse, the particular word dhatte, eternally accepted and not the word dhitva, accepted for the occasion is used.
This is explained by the Acharya.
This is explained by the Acharya.
This is explained by the Acharya.
This is explained by the Acharya.
This is explained by the Acharya.
Dhatte means eternally accepted, not temporarily accepting something.
The idea is that the Lord does not create the fish incarnation, he eternally has such a form and appearance or disappearance of such an incarnation serves particular purposes.
So, the Matsya Avatara, the personal form of the Lord, the incarnation of the personal form of the Lord, Swamsha, his personal form, he appears in different incarnations.
Matsya, Kurma, Varaha, Narasimha.
Personal.
So, these are eternal forms.
These are not temporary forms.
In the Bhagavad Gita, in 7th chapter, 24th and 25th verses, the Lord says, the impersonalists think that I have no form.
They think that I am formless.
And they also have a theory that I accept a form to serve a purpose.
Because of which I am now manifested as a human being.
But such speculators are without sharp intelligence.
Avyaktam vyaktimapannam manyantemam abuddhaya manyante.
They think like that.
Because they lack sufficient intelligence.
Though they may be good.
